When I run a paragraph, it gets saved but $scope.originalText still has old value.

Steps to reproduce:
 1) on a new notebook, type "HelloWorld" in a new paragraph
 2) run the above
 3) paragraph gets saved
 4) now try changing it to "HelloWorld1" and then back to "HelloWorld" 
 5) now try changing it back to "" (blank)
Thanks, I just updated the value when we run and update the paragraph
Tested, LGTM.

Thanks @prabhjyotsingh for the nice improvement.

Will it be possible remove binaries under `zeppelin-server/src/test/resources/firebug` from source tree and download them on the fly during the test?

Yes, I thought about it as well (to download from https://getfirebug.com/releases/firebug/1.11/)  and then continue. But then I didn't wanted CI to break in case it fails to download.

Also we don't expect to those "*.xpi" to change anytime.

Notebook Rest API returns,

```
CREATED, on createNote
OK,      on deleteNote
CREATED, on cloneNote
```

Interpreter Rest API returns

```
CREATED, on newSetting
OK,      on updateSetting
OK,      on removeSetting
OK,      on restartSetting
```

This PR adds 8 more APIs

```
ACCEPTED, on runNoteJobs
ACCEPTED, on stopNoteJobs
OK,       on getNoteJobStatus
ACCEPTED, on runParagraph
ACCEPTED, on stopParagraph
ACCEPTED, on registerCronJob
ACCEPTED, on removeCronJob
OK,       on getCronJob
```

I think return Status need to be little bit more consistent.
For example, removeCronJob returns `ACCEPTED`, but deleteNote returns `OK`.

So, i think changing `ACCEPTED` to `OK` for all new APIs makes api more consistent.
What do you think?
